edu.rit.m2mp
Class IncomingMessage

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.IncomingMessage
public class IncomingMessage
extends Object

Class IncomingMessage encapsulates a message that is received via the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP). Incoming message objects are not constructed directly. To receive an incoming message:

  1. Create an incoming message notifier object by calling the createIncomingMessageNotifier() factory method on an M2MP Protocol object.

  2. Register one or more appropriate MessageFilters with the incoming message notifier.

  3. Call the incoming message notifier’s accept() method. This will return an incoming message that matched one of the registered message filters.

  4. If desired, call the incoming message’s getSource() method to find out which entity sent the incoming message.

  5. Call the incoming message’s openInputStream() method to get an input stream for the message.

  6. Read the message contents from the input stream.

  7. Close the input stream.

Warning: It is very important to close the input stream when finished with it, including when an exception is thrown while reading the input stream. If you don't close the input stream, packet buffers will leak out of the channel, and eventually the channel will no longer operate because no packet buffers are available.

Note: Class IncomingMessage is analogous to an InputConnection in the Java 2 Micro Edition Connected Limited Device Configuration (J2ME CLDC) Generic Connection Framework.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Method Detail

getSource

public ChannelAddress getSource()
Returns the address of the entity that sent this incoming message.

Note: Some M2MP channel implementations always receive packets from the same place, such as a broadcast medium, and do not distinguish among sources. In that case the returned source address is typically that of the M2MP protocol instance’s own channel. See the channel implementation documentation for further information.

openInputStream

public InputStream openInputStream()
                            throws IOException
Open an input stream to read the contents of this incoming message.

Returns:
Input stream.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred. In particular, thrown if an input stream is already open for this incoming message.
